content:
SLAMseq - RNA Stability Analysis

Bioinformatics pipeline for analyzing SLAMseq (Sequencing of Labeled Modified RNA) data to measure RNA synthesis and degradation rates. Uses metabolic RNA labeling to track newly synthesized transcripts and quantify RNA turnover dynamics.

What is SLAMseq?

SLAMseq uses 4-thiouridine (4sU) labeling to distinguish newly synthesized RNA from pre-existing RNA, enabling direct measurement of transcription rates, RNA stability, and identification of immediate transcriptional targets without transcription inhibitors.

Key Features

  • Metabolic Labeling: 4sU incorporation tracking
  • T-to-C Conversion: Identify labeled transcripts
  • RNA Turnover: Measure synthesis and degradation
  • Differential Expression: DESeq2 statistical analysis
  • Direct Targets: Identify immediate transcriptional responses
  • Time-Course Support: Multi-timepoint analysis

Pipeline Workflow

  1. Data Import: Read SLAMseq FASTQ files
  2. Quality Control: Assess sequencing quality
  3. Read Mapping: Align to reference transcriptome
  4. T-to-C Detection: Identify 4sU-labeled reads with Slamdunk
  5. Quantification: Count labeled vs unlabeled transcripts
  6. Normalization: Correct for sequencing depth
  7. Differential Analysis: DESeq2 for statistical testing
  8. Turnover Calculation: Estimate synthesis/degradation rates

Scientific Applications

  • Transcriptional Dynamics: Measure immediate gene responses
  • RNA Stability: Quantify transcript half-lives
  • Drug Response: Identify direct transcriptional targets
  • Developmental Biology: Track rapid transcriptional changes
  • Stress Response: Immediate early gene identification

Analysis Features

  • New vs Old RNA: Distinguish synthesis from stability
  • Conversion Rates: Quantify labeling efficiency
  • Half-Life Estimation: Calculate RNA degradation rates
  • Direct vs Indirect: Separate primary from secondary targets
  • Time-Resolved: Track dynamics over time

Advantages

  • No Inhibitors: Avoids transcription blocking artifacts
  • Direct Measurement: True synthesis rates
  • Time Resolution: Minutes to hours scale
  • Reproducible: Automated workflow
  • Statistical Power: Integrated DESeq2 analysis

Input Requirements

  • FASTQ Files: SLAMseq sequencing reads
  • Sample Sheet: Timepoints and conditions
  • Reference Transcriptome: GTF and FASTA files
  • Experimental Design: Labeling time and replicates

Main Outputs

  • Labeled Read Counts: T-to-C containing transcripts
  • Unlabeled Counts: Pre-existing RNA levels
  • Conversion Rates: Labeling efficiency per gene
  • Half-Lives: RNA stability estimates
  • Differential Results: Statistical comparisons
  • Direct Targets: Immediate transcriptional responses
  • QC Reports: Quality metrics and diagnostics

Perfect for: RNA Turnover • Transcription Dynamics • Drug Response • RNA Stability • Immediate Targets
